fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you try to quote a piece of content with a numbered list or bulleted list the content is not quoted and the quote starts after the list
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a bulleted list (like this one)
 # select the list 
 # Go to the + dropdown and select Quote

h3. Expected Results

The list is quoted
h3. Actual Results

The list is not quoted and the quote starts after the list (see screenshot)

!Screen Shot 2021-01-05 at 17.33.06.png!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Trying to quote a bullet or numbered list does not work

fields.description:
Currently, when creating a custom template it will only show in the *Custom* category upon the creation the template:

!Screenshot 2021-01-05 at 11.32.41.png|width=342,height=374!

The option to manually select a category to apply the custom template to would be helpful

 !Screenshot 2021-01-05 at 11.27.01.png|thumbnail! 

- [There’s a Confluence template for that|https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/templates]
fields.summary: Allow Custom Templates to be listed in the Pre-determined Category names in the new In-editor template  feature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

According to the [Task Report Macro documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-task-report-macro/], *Space(s) and Page(s)*** field is not required. However, when using the macro, we notice that the field *is required*, making it impractical to use the macro to pull tasks from all Spaces.

Although this was a product decision to improve performance and reliability, the documentation is mismatching the new behavior.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page.
 # Add the *Task Report Macro* on it.
 # Edit the macro settings.

h3. Expected Results

The *Space(s) and Page(s)* field shouldn't be required, according to our documentation.
h3. Actual Results

The field is required.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: It's not possible to leave the Space(s) and Page(s) field empty when using the Task Report Macro

fields.description:
h3. Description

In the past, it was possible to use the [Task Report Macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-task-report-macro/] to pull tasks from all Spaces, by leaving the *Space(s) and Page(s)* field empty. This was very useful in order to have a wider view and better management of tasks on the Instance. However, the field is now required and the only way to pull tasks from all Spaces would be to manually include all of them, which is impractical.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a way for users to pull tasks from all Spaces using the macro.
fields.summary: Bring back the ability to use the Task Report Macro to pull tasks from all Spaces

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As a Confluence +*Cloud*+ User, I would like to be able to use Microsoft Stream within Confluence pages.
h3. Problem Statement

Currently, the Widget Connector macro does not support Microsoft Stream. HTML or iFrame macro workaround does not apply to Cloud users
h3. Suggested Resolution

Add support for Microsoft Streams into the native macro in Confluence, Widget Connector. This should allow any user within the instance to use the solution.
h3. Workaround

None at the moment...
fields.summary: Add support for Microsoft Stream to Widget Connector macro

fields.description:
The Page Properties Report macro appears to use an internal API of the following form to generate reports:

https://tenant.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/masterdetail/1.0/detailssummary/lines?pageSize=30&pageIndex=0&cql=label+%3D+%22foo%22+and+space+%3D+currentSpace+(+)&spaceKey=FOO&contentId=123456789&countComments=false&countLikes=false&sortBy=&reverseSort= 

This is an internal API, yet there has been a request to provide this information through a public API such that it is supported. 

For further context, see https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/get-page-properties/43848.
fields.summary: Add an API to query page properties report data

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The page getting refreshed without limit when accessing it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with property macro and make sure to add *Project Macro* in one of the column.
 # Create another page and add page property report macro

h3. Expected Results

User able to see result of page property report.

h3. Actual Results

The page keep getting refreshed.

h3. Workaround

Remove Project macro from the page property.
fields.summary: Infinite reload page loop with page property report macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Table of Contents macro is a great feature that allows us to quickly navigate through our page in a matter of a click!
 At this moment, it seems that it is not handling headers that contain the special character *%*, which breaks the page once you click.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page;
 # Insert the *Table of Contents* macro;
 # Add a header 1;
 # Type *%*;
 # Publish the page and click on the ToC link to *%*.

h3. Expected Results

You are redirected to where the header is (in this case, the page would reload)
h3. Actual Results

The entire page gets broken with random error codes, like the below one:

!image-2020-12-30-10-32-30-433.png!
h3. Workaround

Edit the page and remove the *%* characters from the headers.
fields.summary: ToC link breaks the page if a header has %

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Cannot edit Confluence page due to Maximum call stack size exceeded error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Confluence page in the attached format. (Screenshot1)
 # Try to edit the table by clicking the last row(Screenshot2). The table disappears with a call stack exceeded error in the browser developer logs(Screenshot3).

h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to edit the Confluence page without any errors.
h3. Actual Results

The table is not rendered correctly in the edit mode and throws call stack exceeded error.
h3. Workaround

It may vary with the Confluence page. In this specific case, it was resolved by first clicking the first row of the table and then editing the last row.
fields.summary: Cannot edit Confluence page due to Maximum call stack size exceeded error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * When an Excel/Google Sheets table or cell contains a number/hyphen and a line break, the content of the cell cannot be pasted into the Confluence current edit.
 * If the number/hyphen or the line break is removed, the table can be pasted without any issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Excel/Google Sheets file.
 # Add the following into a cell.
 ** 
{noformat}
1. Some
Text
{noformat}

 ** To enter a line break in Excel
 *** For Windows – ALT + Enter.
 *** For Mac – Control + Option + Enter.
 # Copy and paste the cell into an editor in Confluence.

h3. Expected Results
 * The content is copied into the editor as a table.

h3. Actual Results
 * Nothing happens when we paste the values in.
 * The following request is seen in the Network tab, which seems to indicate that the paste worked without any issues.
 ** Request URL: <SITE>.atlassian.net/gateway/api/gasv3/api/v1/batch
 ** 
{code:java}
{"success":true,"validationErrors":null,"message":null,"code":0}{code}

h3. Workaround
 # We can work around the issue by either,
 ## Removing the dot, "." next to the number.
 ## Removing the line break.
 ## Adding another number after the line break.
 # For example,
 ** (x) Cannot be pasted
 *** 
{noformat}
1. Some
Text
{noformat}

 ** (/) Can be pasted
 *** 
{noformat}
1 Some
Text
{noformat}

 ** (/) Can be pasted
 *** 
{noformat}
1. Some
2. Text
{noformat}

 ** (/) Can be pasted
 *** 
{noformat}
1. Some Text
{noformat}
fields.summary: Excel tables with numbers or hyphen and break lines cannot be pasted into editor
Check content permissions returns always hasPermission: true

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*

In the new editor, there is no option to configure the title field. So you cannot see the title or metadata of the image when you hover the mouse over the image.

*Steps to Reproduce*

Create a Confluence page using the new editor.
 Add an image
 There is no option to add the title field.

*Workaround*

NA
fields.summary: Ability to configure title field in the image for new editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The analytics feature that we have on Confluence is awesome, and grant us interesting data to understand how our content is being used and how relevant it is!
Depending on how the different organizations are set, some analytics features are missed, and they could be great to be in the Atlassian products!

h3. Suggestion
* Add an advanced analytics feature to also provide data about the user traffic, like how the users are navigating between the products we have (Confluence x JIRA), as well as when they come to one of our products from an external site (like when our sites are open for anonymous access, or we have a link to one of our products in an external site, for example).
fields.summary: Advanced analytics for traffic

fields.description:
{panel:title= Bug Fix Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
 You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

The link in ToC doesn't work properly due to the lack of [percent-encoding|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percent-encoding].

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with a header: "H2 10% Sample Header"
 **  !Screen Shot 2020-12-22 at 11.39.50.png|thumbnail! 
 # Place a [Table of Content|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-table-of-contents-macro/] (ToC) macro
 # Publish the page
 # Click the link in the ToC
 # The error occurs: "We've hit a snag"
** !Screen Shot 2020-12-22 at 11.40.18.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results

User can jump to the linked header via ToC.
h3. Actual Results

Links with percentage don't work due to the error below:
{code:none}
URIError: URI malformed at decodeURIComponent (<anonymous>) at X.renderRenderer (https://confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/fabric-renderer~dc51bad7.SqPhw8aBSf.js:25:4778) at https://confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/fabric-renderer~dc51bad7.SqPhw8aBSf.js:25:5587 at re (https://confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/67.Uft3zQy746.js:151:46945) at $i (https://confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/vendors~4134d62c.MLUonLJw2g.js:2:668899) at Da (https://confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/vendors~4134d62c.MLUonLJw2g.js:2:677760) at yu (https://confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/vendors~4134d62c.MLUonLJw2g.js:2:716357) at cs (https://confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/vendors~4134d62c.MLUonLJw2g.js:2:707686) at us (https://confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/vendors~4134d62c.MLUonLJw2g.js:2:707611) at Zu (https://confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/vendors~4134d62c.MLUonLJw2g.js:2:704641)
{code}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: TOC Macro URI malformed error occurs with a link containing percentage

fields.description:
Newly created pages are not showing in the page tree. Two pages I created yesterday did not immediately show up in the page tree after publish, but did show after a refresh. Now, today, neither page is visible in my page tree again.

Impact Start Time: 2020-12-15 23:00 (UTC)
Impact End  Time: 2020-12-18 9:00 (UTC)
fields.summary: New pages are not showing in the page tree

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary When a page has a table without , the page can't be exported to PDF This was noticed on pages using the legacy editor but it can also affects the current editor if it includes pages with that issue, using the excerpt-include macro. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Open a page that contains an empty table. Eg.: {code:html}
{code} # Try to export it to PDF h3. Expected Results The page should be exported h3. Actual Results An error is thrown: {code:none}There was an error in the export. Please check your log files.{code} Internal error: {code:none}java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index 0 out of bounds for length 0{code} h3. Workaround Remove the empty table from the page or convert it to the current editor; Ps.: The error will also happen if the original page is on the current editor but it uses an excerpt-include macro to include pages from the legacy editor that contain an empty table.
fields.summary: Can't export pages with empty tables to PDF

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we are sharing pages with the *share* feature, a cool feature it has is the message box, so we can provide our public with a bit of context about what that page is about. Though it accepts text, it would be nice to have some editing features there, to customize the text and highlight pieces of our message, for example.

h3. Suggestion
* Add some editing features with WYSIWYG in the message box for page sharing.
fields.summary: Editing features in the Share Page message box

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, the message we can type when sharing a page with someone supports only 500 characters, which sometimes cannot be enough to provide context to the public we are sharing our pages.

h3. Suggestion
* Increase the character limit from 500 to 1000.
fields.summary: Increase the character limit in the Share Page message

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you have very long comments (at the bottom of the page), eventually the tab freezes in a Chrome browser (Google Chrome, Edge, Brave, etc) and crashes. I've had this happen multiple times now, and the only solution is to open it in Safari (on my Mac) and delete those long comments.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create long and large number of comments on a page. 


h3. Expected Results
The page should not freeze or become slow

h3. Actual Results
The page freezes


h3. Workaround
--
fields.summary: Very long comments on the page, cause the page to freeze in Chrome

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On Confluence Cloud, it's possible to *star pages*, so you can easily find them later. You can find the list of *Starred pages* directly on the top navigation bar: *Recent > Starred*. However, all pages are displayed as if they were starred *more than a month ago*, even if you star a page today.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a page.
 # Click on the star icon.
 # Now, check your Starred pages list, by navigating to *Recent > Starred*.

h3. Expected Results

The page should be listed as *starred today*.
h3. Actual Results

The page is listed as starred more than a month ago. The information is incorrect on both the top navigation bar, and also when checking the complete list (clicking on *view all recent pages*).
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: All Starred pages are being listed as "More than a month ago"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Issue Statistics macro in Confluence does not display all the "Project or Saved Filter
" fields as intended, with the top one underlapping another, which has made it difficult to use it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Insert a Issue Statistics macro in confluence page.
 # Step 2 and try to select "Project or Saved Filter" field value.


h3. Expected Results
It should show the drop down option.

h3. Actual Results
The "Project or Saved Filter" field is underlapping the "Statistic Type" field.
 !image-2020-12-21-20-11-09-923.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issue Statistics macro is underlapping

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Attached Files are not displaying previews after editing by Atlassian Companion.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add excel file to a page
 # Edit the file by Atlassian Companion
 #*  !image-2020-12-21-18-11-59-095.png|thumbnail! 
 # Save the file
 # Go back to the page

h3. Expected Results
The file is displaying preview.

h3. Actual Results
The file is not displaying preview.
*  !image-2020-12-21-18-12-40-401.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Attached Excel Files are not displaying previews after editing by Atlassian Companion

fields.description:
Currently, users need to create script with REST API to bulk delete pages. 
It would be useful if users can bulk delete pages created before some date from UI.
fields.summary: Ability to bulk delete pages created before some date

fields.description:
*Description:-*

Currently, when there are multiple anonymous spaces, a keyword search in one space will return URLs for anonymous public spaces also. This may cause inconvenience to users where the spaces are independent and used by different teams.

*Steps to replicate:-*

1) Create two anonymous spaces with content inside it.
 2) Do a keyword search in one space. It will return URLs from the other space also with similar keywords.

*Suggested Resolution:-*

Provide a configuration so that the search in an anonymous space returns only content from that space or specific spaces configured for search.
fields.summary: Ability to configure search for anonymous spaces.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a linkable heading is placed inside of an expand macro, its link won't work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a page, add some paragraphs of text in order to fill more than a page
# Add an expand macro at the bottom and insert any heading text inside of it
# Publish the page and copy the link for that heading
# Open the link on another tab

h3. Expected Results
The page should scroll down to the expand/ heading.

h3. Actual Results
The page opens but doesn't scroll down.


h3. Workaround
 Currently, the only workaround is to move the heading to outside of the expand macro.
fields.summary: Linkable headings don't work inside of an expand macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A specific user when trying to Move page from one space to another (having all required permissions) , encounter metadat type messgae display in UI as shown below -

!image-2020-12-19-02-51-55-748.png|width=485,height=62!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(For specific affected users only)
 # Create a test page in a space .
 # Trying moving the page with *Move* operation to another space

h3. Expected Results

The UI should take the user to new location for the page with displaying the page as normal.
h3. Actual Results

The user gets metadata kind of message on UI and at backend the page actually gets moved
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Move page operation gives metadata type message in UI for specific user

fields.description: Please add a horizontal ruler line that de-marks the current time of day. Additionally, please "grey out" calendar objects that above the line (i.e. in the past).
fields.summary: Team Calendars - Time Of Day horizontal rule line

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Not able to export one or more blog pages to PDF.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a blog post (either on the personal space or a regular space).
 # Go to *More actions>Export>Export to PDF*.

h3. Expected Results
 * Download the file.

h3. Actual Results
 * We see the error message "There was an error in the export. Please check your log files.":
 !pdf_error.png|thumbnail! 
 * The below exception is thrown in the log file:
{noformat}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Opening users page in admin does not give a filter for External collab users
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the users page in the admin UI
 # Open dropdown for role

h3. Expected Results

A role saying - "External collab" users
h3. Actual Results

No role for external collab users
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Opening users page in admin does not give a filter for External collab users

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we are working on Confluence, we have some cool options in the dialog box of the *Files&Images* feature, such as:
* Upload files from our computer;
* Add files from GIPHY;
* Add files from DropBox;
* Add files from Google Drive.

This enables us to have a different sort of sources to use files in our pages, and that's great!
When we resolve to pick files from Google Drive, it only lets us pick files from our personal folders, which sometimes makes the team sharing a bit bad.

h3. Suggestion
Allows the Google Drive option from the *Files&Images* option to search for files that we have access to in all shared folders, not only our personal ones.

h3. Workaround
Meanwhile, we can:
* Install the [Google Drive for Confluence (Official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213092/google-drive-for-confluence-official?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] free add-on and paste the file URL from Google Drive in the page;
* Download the file and upload it to the Confluence page.
fields.summary: Cannot navigate on shared folders using Google Drive option, from Files&Images

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Issue macro does not display custom-field values of Text Field

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Using Jira create a Text Field custom field and associate it to a classic project's screen
|!image-2020-12-18-00-10-17-127.png|width=278,height=63!| |

2. Create some issues in that project, ensure the custom field has some text filled.
 !image-2020-12-18-00-10-40-906.png|width=367,height=64!

3.  Use Jira issue macro on confluence and display the filter results, ensure the custom field is added in the column.
h3. Expected Results

The custom-field(Text Field) should display the values/data in the Jira macro issue output/results on the Confluence page.

h3. Actual Results
 * The custom-field doesn't display any results and is reflected as empty!
   !image-2020-12-18-00-11-03-453.png|width=314,height=52!  

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Issue macro does not display custom-field values of Text Fields
Cursor has random behavior when backing from preview mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Agile Wallboard Gadget formatting is broken.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and add Agile Wallboard Gadget
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

Agile wallboard gadget is being displayed with the correct formatting.

h3. Actual Results

Agile wallboard gadget formatting is as below:
 !Screenshot 2020-12-16 at 16.00.23.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Agile Wallboard Gadget formatting is broken

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User seeing duplicate gliffy diagram. The same issue has been reported for draw.io diagrams also.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and add 1 diagram.
# Then click on gliffy app on the sidebar
 !Screenshot 2020-12-16 at 15.35.13.png|thumbnail! 
# Once you go to the page, and scroll down 

h3. Expected Results

User only see 1 diagram that they created earlier.

h3. Actual Results

User seeing duplicate diagram.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Gliffy showing duplicate diagram

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Events created on Team Calendar (doesn't matter the day) show on Sunday when the calendar is inside a table. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence page;
# Add a table in this page (1 column, 2 rows);
# Add a Team Calendar in the second row;

h3. Expected Results
The page will show the calendar and its events.

h3. Actual Results
All the events of the calendar show on Sunday.

h3. Workaround
Remove the calendar from the table.
fields.summary: Events created on Team Calendar (doesn't matter the day) show on Sunday when the calendar is inside a table

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using the Share button in the top right to generate a share link. The share link generated is for another page (usually previous accessed page) within the same space, but not the actual page we are on.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Page 1 in Confluence in any space.
 # Now open any other page lets say Page 2 from same space in same browser window.
 # Click on Share button at top right corner of Page 2.
 # Click on Copy link for page link to be copied and shared.
 # Open new tab in browser and paste the copied link

h3. Expected Results

The  copied link should be for Page 2 .
h3. Actual Results

The copied page link is for Page 1 , or for any other page from space.
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page again and then check for copying link from share button dialog box.
fields.summary: Using Share button dialog provides link to the wrong page

fields.description:
All users become from 2015 has request this new feature in the editor:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36109

*Why not is posible solver this? Or this issue has soved?* This editor is very bad, hard, no agile, so, is very iimportant tha Jiira Confluence Cloud Team consider these comments of youur customer.

Regards

Geoffrey Porto, CTO at Alteumx.com and Varopago.com
fields.summary: PLEASE!! URGENT!!! Anyone need a copy formatting tool in Text/Confluence editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
With [the Analytics app|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/view-analytics-to-see-how-content-is-performing/], users are able to see metrics like the number of page/space views, including options to filter a specific date range.

When using the *Page analytics* (for metrics related to a single page), if the user changes the date range, the number of views won't change in order to match the specific filter.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to have a page and access it multiple times (I.E. refreshing it). You can also use a page that has been accessed previously.
# View the page analytics by either:
## Tapping the *Analytics* icon on the sidebar and then, selecting the specific page under the *Pages* tab or under the *Most popular pages* part under the *Space analytics* option.
## Tapping the *Analytics* icon displayed under the page's metadata (last updated/created by) and then, selecting the *View Analytics* option.
# Under the page analytics *View* tab, change the date range. For example, both options pointing to the previous day so the number of views should be reduced (assuming that the page has been accessed in the current day).

h3. Expected Results
The *Views* number on the bottom should be updated.

h3. Actual Results
The number of views remains the same.

(i) *Additional notes*:

* The graphic for the page views is properly updated, demonstrating the number of views.
* The space analytics properly reflects the views by tapping the *Pages* option instead of accessing the single page analytics.
* This also affects anonymous views.

h3. Workaround

As a workaround to get the correct views for specific pages:

* Use the *Analytics* option from the sidebar of the space, which will give the *Space analytics* menu and then, select the *Pages* option.
* On the *Page analytics*, hover the cursor over the graphic after updating the date range. This will demonstrate the updated number of views.
fields.summary: Sorting date in Page Analytics does not change the number of views

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 # When a Space has anonymous access enabled, users visiting restricted pages are prompted to log when viewing the page on a desktop browser.
 # When visiting the same page on a mobile browser however, the redirect does not happen.
 # User is presented with a *Request access* option, which fails as they are not yet logged in.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable Anonymous access on Site and Space level.
 # Create a restricted page in the Space.
 # Open the page in Incognito/logged out.
 ## On desktop browsers: User is redirected to log in. (/)
 *** !Desktop.PNG|thumbnail!
 ## On mobile, the user is shown the *Request Access* option, which will fail. (x)
 *** !Mobile.PNG|thumbnail!
 *** !Mobile2.PNG|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
 * Users who are not logged in on mobile should also be redirected tp the log in page.

h3. Actual Results
 * User on mobile are shown an option to *Request Access* that will not work,

h3. Workaround
 * Users will need to manually log in, and come back to the page to *Request Access*.
fields.summary: Login redirect not working on mobile browsers when Anonymous access is enabled

fields.description: The bulk user fetch API only supports OAuth authentication. This API is also required for Connect apps (JWT authentication).
fields.summary: Add Connect app support for the bulk user fetch API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User modals (mentions) present in a table within page properties macro, overlap its modal user content when clicked with below present table or macro content
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with page properties macro and a table within.
 # Mention few users in the lower most table cell.
 # Insert a table/layout below the page properties macro on same page.
 # Click on user mention to display user info.

h3. Expected Results

The user details (modal) should display as normal .
h3. Actual Results

The user modal details gets overlapped over the content in below table/layout content as shown below -

!image-2020-12-15-01-40-18-246.png|width=196,height=86!
h3. Workaround

Insert some text lines or blank spaces below the page properties macro to have modal dialog present completely before another macro in below.
fields.summary: User mention in table within page properties macro overlap user modal dialog box with content

fields.description:
1. Please provide the Expend width option in Roadmap Planner addon or provide an option to make it full width in view by Month option.

 !image-2020-12-14-23-04-22-883.png|thumbnail! 

2. Allow second line/next line option in the Bar name, so we can view the full name wile presenting the page.
fields.summary: Ability to expand the Roadmap Planner width in Month view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unnecessary underline is specified in "Attachments".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click *...* (More actions) on a page
 # See the "*Attachments*" text decorated with the underscore

h3. Expected Results

No underline is contained as other options are.

h3. Actual Results

It's easiest to see the screenshot as it's a cosmetic problem:

 !Screen Shot 2020-12-14 at 11.40.10.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unnecessary underline text decoration in "Attachments"

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

In CQL, we can search for pages with specific labels with the below criteria.

https://xxxxx.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/search?cql=type=page and label =' some label'

However, it is not possible to search for pages that do not have labels.
h3. Steps to replicate
 # Invoke Confluence REST API https://xxxxx.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/search?cql=type=page and label =' some label' on a space that has some labels. The query will return the page URLs.
 # Now modify the REST API to search for pages without labels.(try label='', label=null etc). The label criteria will be ignored in the query.

h3. Suggested solution

Enhance CQL so that it can search pages without labels.
fields.summary: Enhance CQL to search pages without labels.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA Issues macro only allows for row headings, that is, the headings are all on the top row.

h3. Suggested Solution
We should provide a way that customers can switch to the first column as a heading instead, should they so chose

h3. Why this is important
We already offer the way to switch headings in our table macros, so we should allow the customers to use the same formatting for their JIRA Issues Macros
fields.summary: Support column headings in JIRA Issues Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Recently, when invited to a Confluence Cloud instance, as a part of the onboarding process, users have a personal space created automatically.

This sometimes can clog up the instance and it would be useful to have an option to disable it on a site-level instead of disabling the creation of personal space for each group having access to Confluence.
h3. Workaround

You can disable Personal Space permissions for user groups in Global Permissions.

Please note that; with this workaround, users will not be able to create their personal space manually too.
fields.summary: Ability to disable the personal spaces creation automatically

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When support and admins have been impersonating users in their instance - this is not being correctly propogated through search. So understandably, they are not able to reproduce issues with other users or correctly retrieve the appropriate results for the impersonated user
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Impersonate the user through the admin UI
 # Execute an advanced search for results that the impersonated user does not have permissions to

h3. Expected Results

The search should NOT return the results the impersonated user does not have permissions to.
h3. Actual Results

The search does return those results since the actual original user ( not the impersonated user) has permissions to see it. 
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Trying to impersonate a user for Advanced Search or Quick Search does not work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When inserting a Filter Results macro in a page, when you try to do some modifications on the filter or change the fields, upon modifying it, the preview never loads and it loads intermittently on the published mode.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a *Filter results* macro on a page.
 # Insert a filter
 # Click edit to add fields in the macro.
 # Preview
 # Save the macro
# Publish

h3. Expected Results

The Filter results macro should display the changes made and load the macro  everytime you access the page or reloads it.
h3. Actual Results

The Filter results macro becomes irresponsive and loads the content on the macro after refreshing the page a few times.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no workaround available.
fields.summary: Filter Results macro works intermitently

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to download emoticons from their viewformat URL using the Confluence REST endpoint.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create new Confluence page
 # Insert an emoticon from the set of old emoticons
 # Use /rest/api/contentbody/convert/export_view to get view format

h3. Expected Results

Confluence returns image data or redirects to proper image location.
h3. Actual Results

Confluence redirects to the login page.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Confluence REST endpoint /rest/api/contentbody/convert/export_view doesn't export emojis

fields.description:
h3. Current Scenario
Currently, when a page is deleted it is moved to the *Trash* section of a space, and if you want to purge pages you'd have to manually go through each of them, purging one-by-one.

h3. Desired Outcome
Space admins should have the option to bulk purge pages, including the use of filters, for example, pages that have been in the trash for more than X days// order pages alphabetically // order pages by attachment size // etc.
fields.summary: Bulk purge pages on space trash

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
"calendars3.space.calendars.view.heading" is shown in the Type dropdown of the search screen

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to the search screen(https://<instance name>.atlassian.net/wiki/search)
 # Expand the Type dropdown

h3. Expected Results
The options are shown in a user-friendly format

h3. Actual Results
"calendars3.space.calendars.view.heading" is shown in the options
 !スクリーンショット 2020-12-11 16.18.38.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When filtering the search result by type, unknown "calendars3.space.calendars.view.heading" is shown

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Updating the title of a page with legacy editor content using the REST API results in the the content switching to the new editor regardless of whether it can be safely converted or not.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with legacy editor content.
 # Modify the page to include content that can not be converted to the new editor format. For example, nested expands.
 # Update the title and content of the page using [PUT /wiki/rest/api/content/\{id}|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content/#api-api-content-id-put]. Either `storage` or `editor2` content can be provided here.
 # Reload the page.
 # Use [Property Inspector|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1223854/property-inspector-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] to view the version of the page. The version of the editor content is still "v1".
 # Update the title of the page using [PUT /wiki/rest/api/content/\{id}|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content/#api-api-content-id-put]. Don't pass any new content within the `body` part of the request.
 # Reload the page.
 # Use [Property Inspector|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1223854/property-inspector-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] to view the version of the page.

h3. Expected Results

At step 8, the version of the editor content is still "v1" and renders as it did before.
h3. Actual Results

At step 8, the version of the editor content has change to "v2" and does not render properly due to containing content that can not be safely converted to the new editor.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Updating a page transitions content to the new editor
Copy single page API with custom body does not work anymore

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On Confluence Cloud, it's possible to create a page importing a Google Document. However, this functionality is not working as expected on Instances which the URL is *.jira.com* **(instead of *.atlassian.net*).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access an Instance with this URL structure.
 # Click on Create a page (make sure that the Instance has the new template gallery).
 # Switch to *Import* tab.
 # Select *Google Doc*.
 # Authenticate to the Google account that has the desired document.

h3. Expected Results

After authenticating the user, the Instance should prompt a list with the Documents from this Google account, so the user can choose the desired one.
h3. Actual Results

User is prompted with below error message:

!image-2020-12-10-13-06-17-216.png|width=673,height=397!

Below error is thrown on browser console:
{code:java}
Failed to execute 'postMessage' on 'DOMWindow': The target origin provided ('https://docs.google.com') does not match the recipient window's origin ('https://<INSTANCE>.jira.com').  {code}
h3. Workaround

Engage Atlassian Support, so we can edit some settings on the Google integration.
fields.summary: Import from Google Docs is not working for instances named *.jira.com

fields.description: Rather than having to individual archive articles, it would be useful to be able to archive the entire folder at once. The archive could then retain the folder structure.
fields.summary: Archive entire folder

fields.description:
I have lots of client pages with child pages of individual meetings that include tasks.

Space (Business) - Name of Client - Child pages with date and meeting notes

I insert the Task Report macro in the main page of each client to pull out all the tasks from the child pages.

When inserting the macro it always suggests the "Business" page, which is the Space I'm in. I always have to change it to the current page (the client).

Wouldn't it make sense to change this behaviour to the current page?
fields.summary: Task Report macro. automatically show tasks of current page, not main page

fields.description:
Information are misleading when trying to report a bug to Atlassian. 

As a user I clicked help button on my confluence and only option is "give feedback"

!image-2020-12-10-09-47-35-964.png!

as I want to report a bug, i go to the support site, fill the form. 

!image-2020-12-10-09-48-55-537.png!

 

and i have no mean to report the bug. I don't need help of the community nor need of documentation.

 

You guys makes great software for others, i'm confident you will find a way to improve this for everyone's interest. 

 

Thanks, 

 

Lionel
fields.summary: Improve bug reporting

fields.description:
Hi,

 

As a *confluence user*

I'd like to *select an array of cells*, then select a button to *clear the content* in those specific cells *only*

So that I can *retain certain information* in cells *whilst deleting content in others* and saving a large amount of time doing this with a big table of data.

 

thank you,

Kurt Smith
fields.summary: Clear Cell Content Button | Suggestion

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, creating a personal space triggers the automatic creation of a series of sample pages. There appears to be no way for the administrators to modify the Personal Space blueprint to exclude these pages.

!sample-pages.gif|width=256,height=353!
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a capability for admins to automatically disable this part of the personal space blueprint or determine their sample pages. 
h3. Workaround

No current workaround. Delete the sample pages manually.

Personal space creation can be disabled in [Global Permissions|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/manage-global-permissions] in Confluence administration. Go to *Settings > Global Permissions*, click on *Edit* and uncheck the box *Create Personal Spaces* for the default Confluence access group (otherwise, the group you don't want to have access to create personal spaces).
fields.summary: Ability to disable the sample pages created automatically with the personal spaces

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira custom fields with a duplicate name to system fields cannot be rendered in the Jira Macro table.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field called "Progress" and associate it with your project.
 # In the Jira Issues Macro search screen identify the issues that have some value in the custom field you created in step 1.
 # Insert a Jira Issues Macro into a Confluence page using the same JQL and edit the columns to display the custom field.
 # Save the page.

h3. Expected Results
 * The data of the columns are showing on the Jira Issue macro like on the Jira side.

h3. Actual Results
 * The data of the columns are showing blank.

h3. Workaround
 * Rename the custom field to a different name.
fields.summary: Jira custom fields with a duplicate name to system fields cannot be rendered

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we add Jira issue link to a Confluence page inside a Table of Content Zone macro, then the issue is always rendered as Issue URL. Even if it set to display as Issue Link.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a Table of Contents Zone macro to a page
 # Add Jira issue link inside this macro. And set it display as "Display as Link"

h3. Expected Results
Its displayed as link after publishing

h3. Actual Results
Its displayed as URL.


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding Jira issue link on Table of Content Zone Macro always renders the Jira issue as URL
Body is not changed when copying page with API

fields.description:
We are working on a License Management Scenario for Confluence Cloud.
It would be good to have an API which would allow the Site-Admin to fetch the details of the plan that has been subscribed.
Details of the plan that could be useful :
Plan Name
Site Name
Site ID
fields.summary: API to get the plan details subscribed for Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
Don't see "protocol buffers" as a language option in code snippets

!image-2020-12-08-08-37-33-922.png!
fields.summary: Syntax highlighting for protocol buffers in code snippets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Live Search Macro Does Not "Suggest Results" When navigating away from the page and using the back button to return
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Instert The Live Search macro unto a page
# Search for a term (Suggested results will show)
# Navigate away from the page using any available link
# Press back button to return to the page with the Live Search macro
# Search for a term (No Suggested results)


h3. Expected Results
Suggested results should show

 !Screenshot 2020-12-08 at 16.13.47.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
No results are shown unless selecting the search button.


h3. Workaround

Refreshing the page after returning resolves this issue
fields.summary: LiveSearch Macro Does Not "Suggest Results" When navigating away from the page and returning

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Emojis in a blog are not rendered correctly inside BlogPost macros.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a blog consisting of a star, apple, and heart emoji.
 # Create a Confluence page and insert the blog using BlogPost macro.
 # The apple and heart emojis are rendered incorrectly.

h3. Expected Results

Emojis should render correctly in BlogPost macros.
h3. Actual Results

Emojis like heart and apple are rendered incorrectly in a BlogPost macro.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Emojis in a blog are not rendered correctly inside BlogPost and Task Report macros

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When inserting the decision macro on a page and then exporting the page to PDF the Decision macro icon is larger causing it to overlay on top of the text box 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add Decision Macro to a page
 # Export to PDF

h3. Expected Results
Should Look similar to how the Decision macro is displayed on the Original Page
h3. Actual Results
Decision Macro Icon is larger and encroaches on the text box

*Original Page*
 !Screenshot 2020-12-08 at 07.49.39.png|thumbnail! 

*Export to PDF*
 !Screenshot 2020-12-08 at 07.50.07.png|thumbnail! 



h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Decision Macro icon when Exporting to PDF overlays on text box

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

CQL searches by ancestor returns incomplete results if child pages.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page "Container page".
 # Create a new page "Parent page" so that it is a sibling of "Container page".
 # Create a new page "Child page" so that "Parent page" is its parent.
 # Move "Parent page" so that "Container page" becomes its parent.
 # Search for all children of "Container page": https://your-domain.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/search?cql=ancestor=\{ID of container page}

h3. Expected Results

At step 5, the results include "Child page".
h3. Actual Results

At step 5, the results do not include "Child page".
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Ancestor CQL search results in missing newly added child pages

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
SCORM files are used by learning content and Learning Management Systems (LMSs) to create interactive courses. Confluence doesn't support this file natively.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement support for this type of files.

h3. Workaround
Use a third-party app that supports SCORM files:
- [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?hosting=cloud&product=confluence&query=scorm|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?hosting=cloud&product=confluence&query=scorm]
fields.summary: Support SCORM files natively

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Find and Replace feature is something that came in the new editor to make our lives easier, as it allows us to bulk change multiple pieces of text in a single shot!
Though, it seems that this feature doesn't identify text that is within smartcard links.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page;
# Insert the link of another Confluence page or a JIRA issue as a smartcard.
# Call the *Find and Replace* feature and try to search for the inserted Confluence page title or JIRA issue key/description.

h3. Expected Results
The Find and Replace search is able to find one of the inserted smartcards.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens - the feature doesn't find anything.

h3. Workaround
Use the own Find browser feature to find the piece of content you are looking for.
fields.summary: Find and Replace feature doesn't identify text from smartcards

fields.description:
There is a recurring use case to duplicate some pages between accounts and Confluence spaces. The ability to export a single page to be imported into another account space would be very helpful to the knowledge management lifecycle in large enterprises.

Ability to change the page creator on a Confluence Page would also solve the issue with Space level imports because forever you must look at person who never worked in your account because you migrated the content between accounts.
fields.summary: Support Confluence Page Level Exports

fields.description: Many drafts can be created due to various failure states. I have 500 abandoned drafts since I started using our Confluence account back in 2016 that recently become visible. It would be helpful to have a bulk delete option for drafts for scenarios like this and will probably save Atlassian storage costs.
fields.summary: Ability to bulk delete Confluence User Page Drafts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While editing a page and getting to the bottom of that, sometimes we fall under a secret bottom of the page that makes the toolbar to disappear.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a 15 paragraph [Lorem Ipsum|https://www.lipsum.com/] text;
 # Paste it into a new Confluence page;
 # Scroll until the bottom of the page;
 # Now, either:
 ** With the mouse scroller wheel, go down again;
 ** Press *Command + Down Arrow* (on Mac).

h3. Expected Results

Nothing happens - you are already at the bottom of the page.
h3. Actual Results

You go a bit more down, which causes the toolbar to disappear.

!Reproducing the bug.gif|width=723,height=359!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
 Though, you can just press *Command + Up Arrow* (on Mac), or scroll up on the screen to get the toolbar again.
fields.summary: Secret page bottom makes the toolbar disappears in editing mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Export to PDF/Word breaks the Jira Issue macro formatting

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Jira issue and note its URL
 # Create a Confluence page, add the Jira issue macro with the link to the created Jira issue. Publish the page.
 # Export the page to PDF (or Word). The formatting of the Jira issue includes the Description and Status. The PDF is shown below.
  !2020-12-07_15-58-44.png|thumbnail! 
 # Edit the page and publish it.
 # Export the page to PDF (or Word).

h3. Expected Results
* The PDF should still have the Description and Status

h3. Actual Results
* The PDF shows only the URL of the Jira issue.
  !2020-12-07_15-59-36.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* Add a */jira* macro and paste the link to the issue, this way, the exported PDF will correctly render the Jira Issue - (!) In case after applying this workaround you edit the page, the JIRA macro for the single issue will be converted to a common smartcard again, which will make the bug happens if you export the page one more time.

Another possible workaround we could apply here is to add the JIRA issue as a hyperlink:
# Let's say you have the issue with key TEST-123, so you type the issue key in the page;
# Highlight the text and press *Command + K / CTRL + K*;
# Insert the JIRA issue link, like _https://<SITENAME>.atlassian.net/browse/TEST-123_;
# Hit enter.
fields.summary: Export to PDF/Word breaks the Jira Issue macro formatting

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
# If we were to add more than one code block into a page, and selecting the Code Language for only one of the blocks, the other blocks seem to show that their language has been set to the language we selected for the first block.
* But once the page is published, the language is only set for block we set the language for, and the rest of the blocks do not have any language set for them

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page and add 2 or more code block macro.
# Set the language for the first code block.
# Click on the second or any other code block, and the language appears to already be set to the same language we chose in Step 2.
# Publish the page, and the language is only set for the first code block.

h3. Expected Results
* When in edit, selecting the other code block should show *Select Language*, instead of the language selected for the previous code block.

h3. Actual Results
# The code block with no language selected will show the language set to the language used last for any other code block.

h3. Workaround
* Make sure to set the language for all code block added, even if the editor shows that the language is already set.
fields.summary: Setting language for one code block macro appears to update all code block macro with no language set

fields.description:
h2.Problem
Currently, watchers receive an email when pages are updated.

h2.Suggestion
It would be a great feature if we could configure that, choosing to notify or not the watchers on specific actions, for example, not notify the watchers when a comment is deleted on a page. Or to just notify watcher in the app.
fields.summary: Ability to configure which notification will be send to Watchers

fields.description:
The table that lists network devices with IP addresses won't sort the IP address column.
It seems that Confluence fails to sort if there are no letters in that column.

The ticket was closed with wont fix due to limited demand: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30390

Suggestion:

It will be useful to have the ability to sort table column with IP address.
fields.summary: Sorting is not possible with IP address in the column

fields.description:
Adobe XD gives error 404 when the link is password protected

It would be valuable to be able to have a Password protected link on Adobe XD and then be able to still post them in Confluence with the smart Card ability.

With reference to the below link:
https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-articles/Embed-Adobe-XD-files-in-Confluence-Cloud-amp-Jira-with-Smart/ba-p/1494205
fields.summary: Adobe XD gives error 404 when the link is password protected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This issue has been created in response to https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/getting-jdbc-and-sql-exception-for-some-api-calls/43530.

Once in a while our atlassian-connect-express app receives a 500 code for API calls with information like:

 

{{{\"statusCode\":500,\"message\":\"org.springframework.orm.hibernate5.HibernateJdbcException: JDBC exception on Hibernate data access:
 SQLException for SQL [n/a]; SQL state [57014];
 error code [0]; could not extract ResultSet;
 nested exception is org.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException:
 could not extract ResultSet\"}"}}

It is not clear why these exceptions sometimes happen. It seems they occur more often on some days than others, and if they happen in one instance, they are likely to happen in another instance also.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Develop an app that calls the Confluence Cloud REST API.
# Expand parameters ~ ?expand=space,history,version,ancestors,metadata.properties,children.attachment
other Params might also cause this issue


h3. Expected Results

500 errors are never returned.

h3. Actual Results
 !Screenshot 2021-08-02 at 10.59.21.png|thumbnail! 


500 errors randomly occur (details above).
h3. Workaround

None. The APIs being called may not be idempotent so it is not safe to retry the call.
fields.summary: Calling the REST API intermittently results in 500 errors

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have configured Confluence Cloud app to be in dark mode, you can note that when creating/editing a page, the editor will shortly displays white, before turning into dark mode. 

(on) This bug affects Android devices running *API 29+* (*Android 10*).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Confluence Cloud Mobile app. 
 # Make sure that the dark mode is enabled.
 # Click on *+* to create a new page.

(on) You can also replicate this bug by editing a page.
h3. Expected Results

The editor should load on dark mode.
h3. Actual Results

The editor will initially load with a white background, then it will change to dark mode.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Loading the editor on Confluence Cloud Mobile App (Android) with dark mode shows a white flash before rendering the dark theme

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Create issue on a page does not show the right projects in the dropdown

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Highlight text on a page.
 # On the highlight hover click "+ Create issue"
 # In the inline dialog click on the dropdown that says "System Jira"
 # Select another Jira, in my setup: "External Test Jira"

h3. Expected Results
* The project list should display only the relevant projects in "External Test Jira". The issue type dropdown should display the relevant issue types

h3. Actual Results
* The project list still displays the relevant projects (and corresponding issue types) from "System Jira"

h3. Workaround
# Highlight text and click "+ Create issue"
# In the inline dialog click on the dropdown and choose the required Jira instance or server
# Click anywhere on the page outside the inline dialog to make it disappear
# Highlight text and click "+ Create issue"
# In the inline dialog choose the required project and issue type.
fields.summary: Create issue on a page does not show the right projects in the dropdown

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Confluence Cloud only allow pages to be archived, not being possible to do that for Blog posts.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement this feature for Blog posts as well.
fields.summary: Archive blog posts

fields.description:
Create the ability to *undo* changes while editing a page after using "Replace" and "Replace All" buttons on the *Find and replace* feature on the current editor.
|!findandreplace.png|thumbnail!|

Creating a button and/or using a shortcut from the keyboard.
fields.summary: Create the ability to undo changes on Find and replace

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we are creating a new page or even editing an existing one, Confluence keeps auto-saving our content automatically at every 30 seconds (by default). This is a very helpful way to keep working with content creation, as we do not have to worry about saving it all the time.
When we hit the close button, Confluence automatically saves our draft form where we stopped, so we can re-take the draft later to keep creating our content.
As we mention in our [public documentation about drafts|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/create-edit-and-publish-a-page/], we recommend only keeping your work as a draft when it's in a very early stage. This is because changes can't be tracked in a draft, and you can't roll back to previous editing sessions - both of which you can do for published pages.
We recommend that because if for some reason you get your editing lost in some way, there is no way to recover a previous version of the draft page.

h3. Suggestion
After the user clicks over the browser close button, or even after the *Close* button from within the editor, pops-up a warning message asking the user if he/she does not prefer to publish a restricted version of that page, in order to prevent any further issue that may occur with the draft content.
fields.summary: Warning message before leaving a draft page

fields.description:
Currently with the image, which is a 2-colour image with a white background and only one transparent alpha channel for text is having the issue whereupon using these images on the page does not render properly. However, Upon accessing it separately works fine.
This type of images does not make any problems in other software as MS-Word or Excel.

-Converting the image to a PNG without transparency makes Confluence display it correctly. 
Therefore, It would be great if we can render images properly in the application even with transparency configuration enabled.
fields.summary: converting Images to PNG with tranparency dosen't display the images properly on the pages.

fields.description: Search is not looking at part of the text of texts that are linked to a URL it seems
fields.summary: Improve search on text with a link

fields.description:
h3.  

When an app declares a blueprint module, the user sees them listed under the category "Marketplace": 

!blueprint.png!

 

From a user experience point of view, it would be better if the blueprints were listed under more relevant categories. This feature request is to add support for apps to specify the most applicable category that their blueprint applies to.
fields.summary: Add the ability for apps to specify categories for blueprints

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

An exception is thrown when using inspect permissions on “comment”.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # When using inspect permissions on “comment” an error is thrown 

{quote}{{java.lang.ClassCastException: class com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.Space cannot be cast to class com.atlassian.confluence.core.ContentEntityObject (com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.Space and com.atlassian.confluence.core.ContentEntityObject}}
{quote}
h3. Expected Results

No error returns
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the browser console.
{noformat}
java.lang.ClassCastException: class com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.Space cannot be cast to class com.atlassian.confluence.core.ContentEntityObject (com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.Space and com.atlassian.confluence.core.ContentEntityObject
{noformat}
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When using inspect permissions on “comment” an error is thrown

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* If a Word file contains a *Text Box*, it cannot be imported as a page in Confluence.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a word file with a text box in it.
** Sample file:  [^Text_Box.docx] 
# Upload to Confluence.
## Either using *...* > *Import Word File*
## Or Create page and select *Import*
# An error is shown.

h3. Expected Results
* Word file imports successfully. 

h3. Actual Results
* Import fails
**  !Text_box_word_import.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* Remove the Text Box and add the text in normally.
fields.summary: Word file with Text Box cannot be imported

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The static content macro documentation inadequately explains the documentation fields. See also [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/unable-to-change-the-macro-documentation-title-of-help/43486].
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # View the static macro documentation ([https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/modules/static-content-macro/]).
 # Create a static content macro specifying one or more input parameters and a documentation field as follows: `"documentation": \{"url": "https://www.foo.com", title: "Foo", altText: "foo"}`.
 # Within a page, insert the macro to view it in editor mode.
 # Modify the macro so that it specifies a custom editor.
 # Within a page, insert the macro to view it in editor mode.

h3. Expected Results

At step 1, all fields are explained clearly.

At step 3, the link to the documentation has a title attribute of "Foo".

At step 5, the link tot he documentation is displayed.
h3. Actual Results

At step 1, the effect of the `altText` and `title` fields within the `documentation` field are not explained.

At step 3, the link to the documentation does not have a title attribute of "Foo".

At step 5, the link tot he documentation is not displayed.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Inadequately explained documentation of static content macro documentation parameter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the fabric editor, using the option to make the quotes bold at the beginning of the text and also removing the bold option from the quotes at the end, works normally when using a MacOS, however, the same is not working as expected when using a Windows SO, making not possible to make the quotes at the start of the text bold, nor remove the bold from the quotes at the end of the same.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure to have access to a Window SO machine and the browser up to date.
 # Create a new page
 # Type a quote character, "
 # Click the bold icon B to change to bold font
 # Type "hello". Your screen should look like this: "hello
 # Click the bold icon B to change to normal font.
 # Type the closing quote character ". Your screen should look like this: "
 hello", but actually looks like this: "*hello"* (note that the closing
 quote is bold, not plain text).

 # On an empty line, click the bold icon B to change to bold font.
 # Type a quote character "

h3. Expected Results

The quotes at the beginning are bold and the bold option is not applied to the quote after it is removed.
h3. Actual Results

The quote character will not be bold, and the bold icon B will be
 deactivated even though you didn't click it.
h3. Workaround

Select the quote manually and add/remove the bold.
fields.summary: Bold option not working properly with quotes characters on Windows

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using the Confluence advanced search is a cool way to find specific content across our site, as the filters help us to refine the search and get accurate results.

h3. Suggestion
* Improve the search fields to also work to refine the already gotten search results:
We search for a page that contains the label "_abc_", so in the results of this search, we could also sort pages that contain a different label "_dfg_".
fields.summary: Improve Confluence search allowing to search in the search results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

resolved comments pop up doesn’t show resolved comments on archived page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any page with inline comment
 # Resolve inline comment
 # Archive the page
 # Go to meatballs menu->Resolved comment

h3. Expected Results

resolved inline comment is shown in popup
h3. Actual Results

popup is empty
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: resolved comments pop up doesn’t show resolved comments on archived page.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 Yellow highlighting of inline comment is not shown on archived page until you refresh it
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any page in view mode
 # Create inline comment
 # Archive the page

h3. Expected Results

yellow highlighting
h3. Actual Results

yellow highlighting of inline comment is not shown on the archived page until you refresh it
h3. Workaround

refresh the page manually.
fields.summary: yellow highlighting of inline comment is not shown on archived page until you refresh it

fields.description:
Task report macro- Moving a page/meeting template from one space to another with task report macro leads to show no tasks on the destination space because the in task report configuration, the space mentioned is still the Old/source space.

Hence users need to go to the edit mode of the page > edit task report macro and then change the space to the current space.

It would be a great idea to bring a feature to set the space to current by default so on moving the page from one space to another - it would not need any sort of modification.
fields.summary: Task report macro- Moving a page/meeting template from one space to another
In-editor inline comments don't show within third-party macros

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Emoticons used in the legacy editor pages are oversized randomly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a page with Legacy editor.
 # Add certain emoticons on the page.

h3. Expected Results

The Emoticons should be reflected fine with the exact size.
h3. Actual Results

In the Edit mode, the Emoticons are oversized and upon publishing the page randomly certain emoticons are oversized.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

As a workaround, after the user publish the page, the emoticons goes back to the original size. Additionally, you can convert the page to the new editor version or in case if the page cannot be converted to the new editor versions, Manually remove and add the emoticons on the page.
fields.summary: Emoticons are oversized in the legacy editor pages.

fields.description:
Hello, 

For one of my applications I am trying to utilize a lettered list rather than a numbered list an example can be seen below. 

a.
b.
c.
d. 

There is currently an option for an automatic numbered list and an automatic bulleted list. Is there any intention of adding an automatic lettered list option to the confluence toolbar. 

Best Regards,

Brandon Londo
fields.summary: Add Lettered List to Confluence

fields.description:
Currently, with the new Space Directory changes for Confluence Cloud, is no longer present the option to see the site spaces only, instead of showing all the spaces in the instance.

It is possible to create categories by adding labels to the spaces and filtering it, but it would consume too much time, depending on the size of the instance and the number of spaces.

This feature request suggests the implementation of the site spaces option, present on the former space directory, the same way that there is the button personal spaces.
fields.summary: Add the site spaces option back to the new Space Directory

fields.description: As a space creator I'm unable to turn off notifications.  If I create a space on behalf of a team I will still be logged as the Creator and get notifications for "edited your page" for the home page created, even if all pages have been set to Unwatch.  For teams that designate space creation to only certain individuals, this can be very annoying to not be able to unwatch.
fields.summary: Space Creators can't turn off notifications
